application.GUI

Class RecipeListGUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.GUI.RecipeListGUI

  • public class RecipeListGUI
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles the GUI of the main recipe table of all the recipes the current user has in database.
    Author:
    Eat_It(Summer 2021 Team)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RecipeListGUI(User user, javafx.scene.control.TableView mainInventoryListTable, ExecutableAndNotExecGUI_View executableAndNotExecGUI_View)
      The constructor has access to the current user, an inventory list and the executable or not GUI.

      This method creates a table to hold all the recipes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RecipeListGUI

        public RecipeListGUI(User user,
                     javafx.scene.control.TableView mainInventoryListTable,
                     ExecutableAndNotExecGUI_View executableAndNotExecGUI_View)
        The constructor has access to the current user, an inventory list and the executable or not GUI. The Constructor method also is responsible for creating the table, textfields. and buttons in the view the Buttons and texfiles have listeners that execute once clicked
        Parameters:
        user - This hold an object that references the current user.
        mainInventoryListTable - This is a TableView object that hold the data for the current inventory of the user.
        executableAndNotExecGUI_View - This is an object of the GUI class that handles recipes that are executable and not.

    • Method Detail

      • createTable

        public void createTable()
        This method creates a table to hold all the recipes. The table is editable and the event listener assures the new data entered is within the constraints.

        public javafx.scene.Scene getScene()
